website_summaries.verdict: The Sony a6100 is a compact, speedy camera with strong image quality and excellent autofocus. Family photographers will love it, but enthusiasts may want to consider the a6400 instead.
cons: Not as well-built as the a6400

customer_reviews.title: Great lense for the price. Just remember, all manual
customer_reviews.text: The lense is completely manual, so don't expect to be able to just point and shoot. It does require some practice, but once you get the hang of it, you can get some lovely shots with a great depth of focus. For macro, get a tripod or something you can stabilise your camera with. Would look get further lenses my Neewer now I've got the skill down.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lens maybe but quality pics say it all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens as a cheap Prime not used it much since I've had it general pics taken with it look ok tonight been to a wedding and put this on instead of image stabilised stock lens and wow some of the pics I took luck awesome considering crap lighting and using stock lens with flash this lens blew my stock lens away without a flash awesome product
customer_reviews.author: michael platts

customer_reviews.title: Great lens and sufficient for 95% of users, at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent out of the box performance. Sharpness is good throughout larger apertures, while build quality is on par with more expensive kits. Fantastic for the price. On a crop sensor (APS-C) 35mm equates to a 56mm focal length, which is almost ideal for general subject-based photography. The only dislikes I have about the lens are that the focus wheel is slow moving (i.e. requires reasonable effort to twist), and the aperture wheel is free moving throughout 1.7-22 (rather than click-based movement). Both of these are minor as they are simply down to personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: CamG.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and a great choice, especially for budgets or beginners
customer_reviews.text: This lens has made getting my Sony a6000 worth it. I only just had enough budget for the camera and its kit lens, but getting this has made all the difference. It works amazingly in combination with the a6000's focus peaking (which lets you tell what's in focus when using the lens's manual focus). The pictures look pretty great. They obviously aren't as good as something much more expensive, but they definitely do the job and as someone just getting into photography this lens has been what really taught me about my camera and its settings. I'm very happy with it, especially on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't matter what glass is used unlike what some people have comment on the reviews, it takes fantastic photos I bought it desperate for a wedding the next day and photos have came out better than someone else's nikon 35mm so on one hand you get what you pay for on the other hand I can't fault it and I normally go for more expensive quality lenses
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Decent lens for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for my Sony a5000. The lens is good, it’s all manual (no auto focus or zoom) so it takes getting used to, I wanted a cheap lens as I’m a beginner and it’s doing it’s job well.
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I happened to stumble across a review of this lens on YouTube and after watching a few more decided to give it a go. I am very happy with the purchase. This lens is great for such a low price. Yes, the manual focus takes a little practice to get right however it takes some lovely photos and creates a great blurry back ground effect when used at a low F stop. Performs great in low light and has become my favourite lens at the moment and will be for some time I think.
customer_reviews.author: c w creed

customer_reviews.title: Great lense for the price
customer_reviews.text: It'll take some time to learn the adjustments and handling of the manual lenses. Once learned, it is so enjoyable activity. It was my first lense other than the kit lense. The 1.7 f lense gives us a crystal clear nice bokeh effects with some efforts. I'm totally in love with it
customer_reviews.author: lee john

customer_reviews.title: Great sharp pictures
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike .great quality I’ve paid three times the price on other lenses and not had this sharpness and quality
customer_reviews.author: antony kulik

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Can be used with Sony a6000..but the quality is bad..unless you are in a really good light. Not supported by sony camera so a lot of features doesn't work. Just bought an used sony original lens, the difference is huge, pictures look professional.
customer_reviews.author: Anny-lv

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value lens
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens. Only had it a few days but it is fun to use. For 60 pounds, it is very good value, image quality is good (4/5) and nice bokeh. Very small too and lightweight which I like.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy lens. Nice shots taken. Manual focus good once used to it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: If you are on a budget then this will suffice, very good glass quality and very birght and clean images.
customer_reviews.author: good

customer_reviews.title: FULLY MANUAL LENS.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, feels nice and heavy, good quality pictures. Fits perfectly on my sony a6000. Fully manual! (love it or hate it)
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru Munteanu

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised as work with Sony NEX Cameras beware
customer_reviews.text: This lens is falsely advertised as working with Sony NEX cameras, and Amazon are not permitting returns of this. So please buy at your own risk and don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Kashif Khan

product_meta.title: Neewer 35mm f/1.7 Manual Focus Lens for Sony E-Mount Digital Cameras with APS-C Sensor, Such As Sony A7III A9 NEX 3 3N 5 NEX 5T NEX 5R NEX 6 7 A5000 A5100 A6000 A6100 A6300 A6500
product_meta.description:
NOTE: Camera is NOT INCLUDED. 

 Compatibility: SONY E-Mount Digital Cameras NEX 3,NEX,3N,NEX 5,NEX 5T,NEX 5R,NEX 6,7,A5000,5100,A6000,A6100,A6300,A6500,A9 

Description: 

 Neewer NW-E-35-1.7 Focus Prime Fixed Lens features smooth focusing operation. Offers you great joy of perfect experience in manual focusing. 

 Premium optical glass for excellent image sharpness and contrast. Designed with circular aperture blade, creates gorgeous background blur effect. Multi-coated technique for exceptional image quality. 

 Compact and exquisite design, all-metal barrel. Precision machining ensures great durability. 

Specifications: 

 Lens Construction: 6 elements in 5 groups 

 Maximum Aperture: F1.7 

 Focal Length: 35mm 

 Filter Size: Ø 49mm 

 Optical Zoom: 0.113x 

 Angle of View: 

 Diagonal 44°20' 

 Horizontal 36°30' 

 Vertical 23° 

 Filter Diameter: 60.5mm 

 Barrel Length: 41mm 

 Net Weight: 176g 

Package Contents: 

 1 x NW-E-35-1.7 Prime Fixed Lens 

 1 x Lens Front Cap 

 1 x Lens Rear Cap 

 1 x Microfiber Cleaning Cloth
feature_bullets: Neewer 35mm f/1.7 first-quality fixed lens with manual focus; Maximum aperture: f/1.7; Focal length: 35 mm.
Compatible with Sony E-mount digital cameras, including Sony NEX3, 3N, 5, 5T, 5R, 6, 7, A5000, A5100, A6000, A6100, A6300 and so on.
All metal construction; Easy focus operation; Multi-coating for superb photo quality.
It is perfect for panoramas and portraits with the best blurred background effect.
Lens caps, front and back, and microfiber cleaning cloth are included. Please note: Camera not included.
